title: RADIOLOGY – BIOPSY
body: This morning I underwent a supraclavicular left lymph node biopsy. It seems my prostate cancer may have spread. I have the greatest admiration for Warwick NHS and the caring community who have progressively sorted me out over recent weeks with a whole raft of ultrasound, CT, MRI and most recently a PET CT scan. For me the care, gentleness, professionalism, and skill the NHS demonstrate is superb, and under the huge pressure of covid. Thank you yet again.

title: Thanks so much
body: I just wanted to say thank you so much to the ambulance crew and staff who were so kind (and calming) when I needed help last Tuesday evening. I was looked after so well by everyone over night and felt completely safe and secure and reassured. Many many thanks. Keep well and safe all of you.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Care in Challenging Circumstances
body:
I was referred to Pinderfields after finding a breast lump. Even though we are in the middle of the Coronavirus emergency, the referral pathway from my GP worked smoothly and quickly. When I arrived at the clinic , the waiting room was set up according to social distancing measures and all staff were wearing protective gear. I felt protected and I hope they did too. The consultant was very kind and explained what would happen. I had a mammogram and an ultrasound scan, both of which were very comfortable and done with care and compassion. All staff were very friendly and it all felt very “normal” - unlike practically everything else at the moment! I received my results after the imaging (fortunately benign), spoke again to the consultant and was discharged.
I know people are feeling concerned about visiting their GP or hospital and perhaps trying “ignore” potentially serious health symptoms like mine but don’t! I was never made to feel like I was inconveniencing health staff, my problem was taken very seriously and I was treated with care and compassion throughout. We are so lucky to have this fantastic health service with all its brilliant staff!

title: The best parking ever.
body:
I was there for an MRI scan and was seen immediately.  I was rushed in preparation including the ear phones, but the 2 radiologists gave me a sense of calm and I was only too willing to get it all done and dusted as quickly as possible.
The only disappointment was that I did not receive a copy of the results as I had done for all my ultra sounds/CT and requesting a copy personally by e-mail proved to be complicated.  Due to the pandemic virus I envisaged a long delay but advising me to contact  medico-legal shocked me.

title: Non covid experience
body: Had to go to hospital with loin pain seen in red zone due to high temp ...had stay bloods scan ecg general observations ..the staff was lovely explained things and though working in a different way didn't loose their professionalism humour or kindness

title: very efficient in time of national crisis
body: I had a very minor issue which I didn't want to bother GP'S about during covid 19 however realised I needed a prescription to resolve. Went online completed their interactive questions and within hours got a message saying prescription ready to collect.  The practice must be under enormous pressure yet efficient as ever if not more so !!!  Very impressed and thankful

title: Excellent care
body: I visited the minor injuries unit this morning (25/04/20) and the level of care given was excellent right from the moment I walked through the door. In this challenging time, the staff are under immense pressure however you would not know it. They are putting themselves at risk every day to treat patients & still with a smile on their face. I was treated with respect and dignity and on my way within half an hour. The staff there are a real credit to the NHS!

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust
Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

title: Thank you!
body: On 15th April 3am my husband and I arrived to triage because my waters broke and regular contractions started within the next half an hour. After the initial check at triage I was taken straight to a monitor for a more detailed check on how baby is doing. Despite telling the midwife who looked after me whilst at the monitor my contractions are now less than 2 minutes and extremely painful, she insisted I would go home and come back as she thinks in only 2 hours I could not be dilated enough to make it to the labour ward and I may need another 2 hours. She continued to repeat the best place to be would be at home because after the monitor the indications were the baby is  fine. I insisted I am not going home because I was concerned I could not deal with that level of pain at home and thats my final decision. Because of this the next step would be to measure how dilated I was and if I would be less than 4 which she continued to insist I am most likely to be I would not be able to go labour ward not my husband would be able to join. After the check she measured a 6 cm dilation and I was taken straight to labour ward; I was hugely relieved that at this point my husband was able to attend. On arrival to labour ward we were designated a room without having to wait at all. The midwife who took over to help with the birth genuinely left me so impressed. She was so calm, supportive and clearly just great at her job. At each step she talked me and my husband through every decision she had to make and why. The student with her also very kind and supportive. Our baby girl arrived at 7am that morning and we could not ask for more about the way we were all looked after from arrival to labour ward until we left to go home that afternoon. Their support, kindness, care and communication whilst there were great and made the whole process seem so much easier let alone all of this of this happened during the Coronavirus pandemic... We thank you all for the way you’ve been looking after ourselves!

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly and welcoming staff
body: I was offered an appointment within half an hour of a phone consult. When I arrived, the receptionists, dental assistants, dental nurses and dentists were incredibly friendly and polite. Even walking down the corridor whenever a staff passed they would smile, and their approachability made me feel welcome. The dentists put me at ease and made me laugh, which really helped relieve my anxiety. There was a huge sense of camaraderie amidst a global pandemic and I couldn’t believe how upbeat and smiley all of the staff were. Many thanks to such an amazing team who put patient care at the centre of their work.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very kind and responsive
body:
I had a blood test and was worried when I had a call on the Friday to say the GP will phone me  Monday to discuss results.
I was very anxious and contacted the surgery explaining this and straight away a kind lady phoned me and reassured me.
Thank you

title: FANTASTIC PRACTICE
body: I have been with Thornley Street Surgery for 16 years, and I can honestly say that I have never been treated badly by any doctor, nurse, phlebotomist or receptionist they have always been polite, and helpful. Yes I agree that it is difficult to get an appointment at times, but I'm sure that if it was an emergency they would fit you in. Thank you all.

title: Fantastic Oncology team
body: Had my first immunotherapy treatment on the 9th April 2020.The procedure was explained to me and the team put me at ease. It was completed in just over an hour and I was fine after. Now not worried about next procedure. They are so caring great team.

author: LeBelle
title: The most caring surgery
body: I have been so poorly for 5 weeks with breathlessness. The doctors have been amazing, so supportive and even have rang me several occasions, always seen me when I was scared. I wouldn’t of been able to of handled the way I’ve felt with out these doctors. I am so grateful and thank the surgery and the doctors that attended to me in this awful time.

title: Disappointing
body:
I contacted Let's Talk as I was feeling really down and suicidal. I had to wait as long as 6 weeks for my assessment. When I was finally assessed the person doing it just sat behind a computer. She never once made eye contact with me. She was like a robot. I then had to wait a further 4 weeks before eventually being offered counselling with a private practice. 
I can't understand why I was made to wait so long for assessment and then counselling ?

title: Excellent practice
body: Service received from the practice is excellent, there is never a problem getting an appointment. Always helpful front-line staff, Doctors are caring and provide an excellent service.

title: Amazing maternity experience
body: I can’t mention name but 2 women that were with me throughout my birth experience were absolutely amazing all the ladies on the ward were amazing but on 11/4/2020 through this awful time they made my birthing experience amazing bringing my little bundle of joy into the world they were professional and didn’t leave my side when my partner couldn’t be there! Anyone going through labour in these tough times don’t worry if you are going into royal derby these ladies are angels and All deserve To be recognised for the job they do day in and day out and should be getting paid skilled pay for the job they do I can’t thank them enough for what they did for me! Thank you ladies

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Practice
body:
Following a terrifying choking episode, experiencing being unable to draw breath.  Following this, I phoned 111 ... I was extremely distressed ... the Call Hander was excellent.  A doctor phoned within about 20 minutes.  She had my medical history; gave me reassurance and empathy.

With Covid19 stretching our amazing NHS to their limits, I cannot praise this Service enough.  THANK YOU.

title: Great service
body:
Had a prostate PSA blood test on the Monday and then an MRI scan at SRH on the Thursday.  
The staff were very friendly and efficient and I felt very at ease whilst at the hospital.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic service at a first-class practice.
body: I have recently been registered at the West Hampstead Medical Centre and have received wonderful service and help both by the staff on the reception and by two of the doctors. I am amazed how speedily everything was arranged including prescriptions for medicines.

title: Excellent practise
body: Excellent doctors and staff. First class service. Nothing is too much and the service is impeccable

title: Great Practice
body: I am very pleased with the medical care I receive, and even more grateful for it.  All of you (doctors, pharmacists, receptionist) have always given us prompt and considerate care and attention and a first class service. This has continued without hitch under the current extremely difficult and dangerous conditions. We think of you every Thursday when we clap. You are our heros.

title: Really great practice
body: Very thorough eye exam and very reassuring explanation from specialist. I got my appointment within three working days!

title: Holistic care in a great practice
body: This practice shows great team work, from the drs to nurses and receptionists. I have been a patient here for many years and it is clear that the partners have made a huge effort to continuously improve things- from services offered to how kindly their staff interact with patients. I always feel the drs and nurses seeing me are genuinely interested and invested in addressing my needs. The drs and receptionists have gone out of their way on many occasions to arrange consultations and tests for me during a very difficult pregnancy, as well as checking in with me for emotional support. In many ways the practice has the feel of a holistic ‘old school’ proper family practice and I feel very fortunate to be a patient here.

title: Terrible patient treatmemt
body: I never leave reviews anywhere as I'm not that type of person unless it's something good but on this occasion I want to pre warn any fathers going through the same thing, my partner has been admitted hear twice and the neglect from both staff and doctors is actually terrible, five different doctors in four months to assess patients as they couldn't find a permanent doctor, mother's not being helped when struggling with the strain of anxiety and depression, I've been told not to name any staff which I won't but just to make you all aware they don't care about patients and have no sympathy for the daily struggles mums go through, my partner has been discharged when she was only 30% better and still struggling and now the second time she is in there she is even worse and they are trying to discharge her after an overdose attempt, I am writing this review to warn of what to expect if you go through a similar situation as a father.

readBy.name: Hertfordshire Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

title: ‘Helpful and Professional’
body: I suffer with anxiety and depression and the doctors and receptionists have helped me a lot over the years. I’ve had some traumatic experiences which has affected my mental health. If I don’t understand something the doctor is happy to explain again. When I needed my prescription in March, the lady I spoke with over the phone was very helpful.

title: 5-Star staff and care
body: My Mum was a resident at Berrycroft Manor for just 5 months. This is a wonderful care home and all the staff are just amazing. If you are considering placing a loved one into the care of others, you have to ensure you can trust the care provider. I would have no hesitation in recommending the team at Berrycroft Manor. They genuinely provide person-centred care with great warmth and thoughtfulness. Their end of life care is also exceptional, thoughtful, and compassionate

title: Amazing midwifes on labpur ward
body: The experience I recorded on labour watd was exceptional each midwife was amazing and supportive throughout the whole experience. However sadly after i was sent to alexandra ward I believe on 3 rd floor that completely changed my experience and the care staff and midwives there were terrible, always rushing, didnt was been introduce themselves appropriately also when administering my medicine didnt even ask for my name. Its such shame after having amazing experience downstairs on labour ward to receive such disappointment on 3 rd floor

readBy.name: The Hillingdon Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent
body: I went in for an ultrasound appointment and was in and out within 10 minutes. All of the staff were very friendly. It was extremely clean and they were clearly well prepared for the pandemic and abiding by the guidelines. Would highly recommend using the services here, even during these challenging times.

title: Arrogant and disrespectful staff without empathy
body: Having been referred to CDAT following a spell in the Crisis House, my hopes for what CDAT offered were high. Unfortunately, they have become a source of extra anxiety for me. They do not always respond to messages, and the wait for any kind of treatment is well over a year. They are completely hopeless as a service and respond with an attitude of arrogance. They seem not to care about people with autism and suicidal thoughts.

readBy.name: Camden and Islington NHS Foundation Trust

title: very professional staff
body: all 3 staff members that looked after me from reception to the person who took care of my wound (i had a deep cut to my finger) very kind and professional. the hospital was a bit of a ghost town due to the current pandemic and with the poor signage it was a bit confusing at first to find the correct entrance, but once in the right department there were some safety measures for the staff (surgical mask) and enough space to distance the other people waiting. i was seen rather quickly. also i really like this glue that they use now instead of stiches, much less painful and gruesome looking and also less likely to get tangled with the dressing.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Very good patient care
body: I had a telephone appointment with the practice due to this current climate. The staff was approachable, friendly and caring; and my doctor understood my concerns and fear and did her best as usual. Due to her caring attitude, I was given urgent and immediate appointments at the hospital. This put my mind at ease and enabled me to relax, insomuch that I sent a message to her to thank her. It was as a result of the service at the practice that I I am now relaxed that I'm healthy. I am confident that my family is in great hands.

title: Kind and reliable
body: Been coming here for years and have always had a great experience. Recently despite the challenging times I was seen quickly and referred immediately. Always friendly and efficient medical staff.

title: Torbay...A team to be proud of!
body: My son visted A&E today with a broken wrist, from the moment we arrived we received wonderful, thorough and professional care. It's intimidating to arrive at A&E in lockdown, with a brave but naturally concerned child however, despite essential PPE and strict guidelines we received so much genuine heartfelt reassurance and heard many a smile through their masks! The hospital is thoroughly clean and the pediatric team were superb,thorough professional care was administered, highly informative with sincerity and real warmth in making a child feel reassured and expertly looked after. Thank you all so so much

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust
Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

title: Amazing Practice
body: A friend of ours was on Willow ward first class care, wanderfull staff very undrestanding and caring towards my friend. They played a great part in her recovery from her illness. Elm ward where she moved from is amazing too, they really look after their patients and care.

title: Kindness and compassion
body:
I visited the A&E department with my partner after experiencing severe abdominal pain and a black out at home in the early hours. Upon arrival we were told that I would have to go in on my own due to covid19. At the time I was six weeks pregnant (my first) and was quite simply terrified about what was going on. After giving my details at reception, I was quickly seen by the triage nurse who was without doubt the most calming and kind person. I was so fortunate that not only did she organise very quickly for me to go to the obstetrics and gynaecology department (something which I understand is very hard to arrange as they are so busy) but she also didn’t leave my side, completing all the assessments I needed prior to going up and reassured me the whole way. She even organised for herself and a fellow nurse to wheel me up as I felt faint. 
I wish I had asked her name as her badge was covered since I would love to give her a gift in thanks. Herself and the other nurses made what really was a daunting, scary and worrying time into one where I felt supported and human. 
In the end, at 3am (3hours after I entered the building) and after lots and lots of tests, I was offered a scan. I was told the scan would be at 8.45 and that I could stay in if I wanted. By this point I decided to go home and come back as the pain had eased somewhat. After the scan conducted by a very knowledgeable and helpful doctor who advised me about what had happened, I was sent home and at the moment everything is progressing well. I am so grateful for everyone’s reassurance and kindness especially at such a turbulent time.

title: Terrible Practice
body: My Husband has the Flu in February this year and no doctor would see him so he got diagnosed over the phone, he then got a UTI of which they tested and confirmed, he started to feel better with Abx but then they changed the Abx to Pencillin on the 2nd day, it then cleared up but after a couple of weeks later he started to feel under the weather again and by this point he was running a temperature so rang 111 as this was Easter Sunday they prescribed more Abx and got told by 111 that if no better in 48 hours then ring the GP to have a urine test, he was still running a temperature and when phone the doctors on the Tuesday the Dr told him “finish the Abx and then I will do a test” we persisted that something was very wrong but no one listened to us, in the end one of the doctors tested his urine and said it was 95% E-Coli, on the 21 st of April my Husband was rushed to Hospital with a temperature of 39.5 and sepsis all because the doctors wouldn’t listen to him, the Queen Elizabeth Hospital was disgusted with how he got treated by so called Health Professionals, I COULD HAVE BEEN PLANNING MY HUSBAND’S FUNERAL, thank god for the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in kings Lynn for getting my husband back to health.

author: Grateful Nurse
title: Everyone pulling together
body: I'm a nurse. I have just been discharged after 12 days battling Covid19. The care I received from everyone, under such difficult circumstances, was awe inspiring. I was in orange zone CAU briefly, then new st15, then recovering in st16 for last 4 days. To see everyone pulling together, some who've not worked in that area or with each other before, was humbling. Such kindness, compassion and professionalism. I'm so thankful and forever grateful

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: indigogz88
title: Community Phlebotomist
body: I have to commend how patient centered this service is.   With the current virus they are going way above their usual excellent service to ensure I am not being sent too far or getting bloods done in one place and as quickly as possible   Karen has been amazing as we are struggling to get cross matching in and she is exploring all options to make this happen so I’m not sat in the ward when I have transfusions for hours waiting for them to do it and then get results.   As a patient who has a 45 min journey to get in to Crosshouse I really appreciate all their efforts. Thank you!

author: EJ14048
title: Cavell centre Peterborough
body:
I was taken to the Cavell centre somewhat unwillingly after a terrible week of harm and attempts to take my own life in a fever of distress.  
The Doctors listened in part to what I said but came to the conclusion that I was a nuisance (despite my obvious injuries and despair) and even threatened me with asking the police to arrest me. It was the police who actually showed some empathy towards me and tried to get help. The open and callous accusation that after a lifetime of caring for others, I was basically a criminal for needing help, has unfortunately proved the last straw. I asked them to help as I felt unsafe and they threatened me.  
I’d like this also to go to the gmc. The people that dealt with me showed inhumane behaviour and feel they would need to help explain why they didn’t prevent my death to my children.

readBy.name: Cambridgeshire And Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great experience
body:
Our birthing experience started at 7am Thursday 23rd April.  I was taken and given a bed whilst having all the checks, speaking to the cesarean team, whilst my husband waited at home. Soon around 9am he was called in and we were excitedly going to theatre. Just before the spinal block an emergency was called to theatre. We got taken to our labour room (empty) and told to wait. We completly understood as our previous girl had been an alarm bell emergency so we were fully prepared to wait for those in a more important situation. Thursday was a busy day and 7 hours later, after being NIL by mouth for 17 hours and 4 hours with no water I just wanted to go home and come back when they were ready. I was feeling sad and just wanted to go. Despite being Completely busy the midwife team saw that I had been sitting on a visitors chair for 6 hours and couldn't apologise enough. She seemed horrified! They got my bed and told us the team (theatre team that had worked all day) had confirmed they would stay on working so our wait wouldn't be in vain. We were beyond grateful, and despite working flat out all day they even clapped us on re-entry!

The section was very calm and clear and controlled. We got wonderful skin to skin afterwards. Like I, my husband had a fantastic experience. He was able to take pictures and be close to me for everything from the spinal block (which they had to redo) to the operation. The team have a wonderful sense of humour and made it an experience we will never forget for all the right reasons.  After a traumatizing first birth we particularly appreciated this bit. 

Recovery was good. It is to be expected- busy ward -lots of rotating staff - strict and necessary proceedures (PPE). But each Member of staff tried to understand us as indivuduals and nothing was too much an ask. Breast feeding was SO supportive and has given me bags of confidence. 

Had him at 17:39 Thursday went home 10:30 Saturday. Thankyou to such a wonderful team of skilled professionals. We were in our own bubble during our time at Musgrove and never felt like we were in the middle of a pandemic.

title: Great practice
body: All staff: receptionists, nurse, pharmacist & doctor are really helpful. They try to respond quickly & explain things well

title: Excellent and compassionate care
body: I was managed at A/E Pinderfields hospital on 26/27th March after being unwell with high temperature, severe headaches and body aches. I spent about 6 hours in the department and was thoroughly investigated including chest X-ray and blood tests.  I was managed in a very compassionate and professional manner by all the staff. I would like to thank the A/E registrar, nurses and the health care assistants who took care of me during my stray in A/E. I would also like to thank A/E consultant who advised me about my results of investigation and further treatment. I have now fully recovered and back at work.

title: Totally Impressive
body:
Arrived at 10:30am on a Sunday having been referred by NHS101 via the local emergency GP service.
Treatment was almost immediate (started within 15 minutes of arrival).
Staff were kind, considerate, honest , well trained (even the lovely cleaner) and totally considerate in very way.
Well done Bolton Royal Infirmary.

title: Great and helpful
body: The receptionists are very helpful and always book me with the right clinicians. Even with online consultations, the clinicians are kind and I can tell they do the most to help me.

title: Efficient practice
body: When I arrived a nurse was waiting at the door to take my temperature and oxygen levels, the staff where very helpful and friendly I am extremely proud of them , especially under these current circumstances.

title: Great practice
body: Had a very reassuring telephone consultation with one of the lovely doctors at WHMC - she listened and responded to my questions appropriately and, while she didn't assume any prior medical knowledge, she did not patronise me either but treated me with respect and gave me the helpful advice I needed. Thank you.

title: Very caring
body: I have had issues with doctors at other surgeries so have changed. The Doctors at buckshaw have been very good with me & they take the time to explain things to me. They seem very kind and caring. Some of the receptionist are lovely but others don’t always maintain confidential info & seem rude at times.

author: Kerray
title: What a fantastic team
body: I was admitted in the early hours after suffering a mild stroke and numerous mini-strokes. The care I received from all the staff in ward A22 was fantastic. The doctors, nurses, domestic staff and occ health were brilliant with me. I know the care that i received in the ward has now given me a chance of a full recovery. What a fantastic team and I can't thank you all enough.

author: S-81
title: Birth of baby
body: Excellent service and delighted with every aspect of the care I received

author: lovebug100
title: Exceptional care
body:
After having chest pains for a few days my friends persuaded me to go to Accident and Emergency. When I arrived I was very nervous but saw a lovely nurse pretty much immediately before having my blood taken and an ECG.  
A few moments after that I was seen by Bex who took he time to listen, understood my concerns and really showed more care, compassion and understanding than I've had in a long time. She managed to refer me for counselling - something I'd been asking my GP for for months. She examined me thoroughly, and when my chest X ray and results came back I was allowed to go home.  
The whole experience from walking in to leaving was amazing and I couldn't fault any of it. Amazing staff

title: Working very hard in demanding conditions
body: I was discharged today after 4 days of in-patient care for suspected then confirmed COVID-19 at Queen Elizbeth University Hospital Glasgow. All staff were friendly, patient, professional and kind. I couldn't have asked for any better care from people who were obviously working very hard in stressful and demanding conditions. Thank you so much and I hope life gets back to something more normal for all of you as soon as possible. Take care.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: mrfixit
title: I received a telephone consultation
body: After a hospital visit, I got a follow up referral to Bexley Dietitians. Because of the covid virus, I received a telephone consult with Elena, a community dietitian. I am happy to say, she was very efficient, very helpful, yet very friendly and reassuring. Well done Elena, thank you.

title: Excellent service
body:
Have been here many times in past 2 years for treatment.  Always confident in the staff and always treated with courtesy and thoughtfulness.  Treatment follow ups always thorough.  So pleased to be able to use this hospital for my care and treatment.  Thank you to ALL staff for prolonging the vision in my troublesome eye.
Coronavirus arrangements were thorough and quality of service in these trying times has been maintained.  A special thank you is well deserved during these unsettling and da gerous times.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

author: KCF87
title: Amazing midwives
body: So yesterday my waters broke and although this was baby 3, I’ve never experienced this before. From the minute I went into triage, until I was taken into the labour ward I was made feel at ease.. now I can’t remember the midwives name who helped in triage but she was fantastic! Aisling was a student midwife who from the moment I got taken into the labour room made me feel at ease... she greeted me with a huge smile (underneath her mask, but I could tell she was smiling) she kept me entertained and relaxed! I know this is the job of all midwives but for a student midwife who was not long out of uni, she was fantastic! She was great with my sarcastic husband and even though I was pretty out of it, there was never any silence. She continued to keep him distracted! We weren’t fortunate enough for baby to come whilst aisling was on shift, baby came 5 minutes after she finished, however we were out in the amazing hands of Karen another student midwife! Who was amazing she was only in the door 45 mins and had helped deliver our little chubby bundle of joy... the other midwife in the room, julie I think her name was she was amazing and I’m pretty sure she deserves a medal for her hands alone allowing me to squeeze them! Each and every midwife I encountered were amazing! But these 3 I remembered names for were just fantastic and i would love people to be put at ease the same way I was... With all this covid-19 going on, these midwives have a tough enough job and they never let anything phase them! Such a credit to your team!

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: GOW5
title: Appreciation
body: I would like to thank all the fabulous staff in ward 4 QMH Dunfermline NHSFife for the care they are currently giving my dad at this challenging time. They are so caring towards dad and us when we phone. Mum was very comforted when a staff member face timed with dad so she saw him for the first time since visiting stopped over 4wks ago. Such a shame the ward don't have their own ipad and have to share with other wards. Contact with family is invaluable for both patients and family especially at this time. If more devices were available to save wards sharing them it would enable patients to maintain contact with their loved ones more regularly. I hope this can be given some consideration.

readBy.name: Office of Clare Haughey, MSP for Rutherglen
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: JMSHendon
title: Help with my job
body: Sarah helped me make decisions about work when I was at my lowest and really didn't know what to do. My manager has not supported me and made it really stressful. He really doesn't get brain injury. It made such as difference having Sarah's support and guidance when I was at breaking point and ready to quit my job. This type of support is invaluable and I feel lucky to have received such a professional, efficient service.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

author: hm-92
title: Excellent care in A&E
body:
A few weeks ago on I had to take my 8 year old son to A&E after he went over on his ankle. From when we got there until we left, the staff were great.  
When I arrived I knew I would need a wheelchair for my son as I couldn't carry him from the car park up to the entrance. I spoke to the charge nurse who was working triage outside and he kindly said he would get one for us if I drove up with him and then parked.  
We were triaged outside as standard right now to ensure we had no covid symptoms. The SCN was kind and friendly with my son which helped him understand that behind the masks etc were just normal people and nothing to be scared of.  
I'd like to highlight the exceptional care we received from an emergency nurse practitioner, I think her name was Lyndsey? She explained everything amazingly and in such a simplified way that my son understood. She treated him very maturely by addressing him mainly and myself when needed. As I a nurse myself I understood what had likely happened however being in parent mode meant everything I knew went completely out my head. Lyndsey's simple explanation helped immensely and her kind and caring demeanor kept us calm.  
Unfortunately due to the PPE I doubt I'd ever recognise her to thank her if I seen her again when I'm at work so I thought that this would be a good avenue to give her the recognition she deserves.  
Thank you! 2 weeks later and my son's adjusting to his boot well although I keep having to remind him he's not invincible.

author: Thank you for everything
title: End of life care
body:
My grandfather sadly passed in ward 8. He unfortunately had covid19. However I would just like to praise the staff from the respiratory assessment unit, to ward 13, to ward 8 and to Eleanor. Every member of every team were so understanding and caring. Even though they knew my papa had covid19 they put themselves at risk everyday and gave him exceptional care. I will never be able to thank the nurses and doctors that cared for him in his final days enough.  
They updated my family daily (who unfortunately could not visit) they looked after myself when I was with him.  
There has been a lot of scary stories in the news about end of life care during these times, but I cannot fault a single thing. Even during these difficult times, I know my papa was well looked after and was comfortable and had amazing nurses care for him.  
Thank you for everything.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Excellent service
body: Always prompt excellent service, lovely staff, excellent Doctors. Always courteous and thorough. Always helpful.

author: Franx88
title: Feeling let down
body:
I have been waiting months for just a follow upon an assessment and everytime I phone to complain about the last call, where I was told "I will find the relevant person and they will call you", I am told the same thing again; "let me take your phone number and someone will call you".  
That really was their reply to me complaining about being fobbed off.  
I feel that this is actually making my mental health problems worse, and I'm finding it more and more difficult every day to actually have any respect for t mental health services. Seems that many want to help, but it seems the mental health team cant decide who is supposed to speak to me. I have never felt so let down.

author: Emmrd63
title: Put her wishes and feelings forward
body: Thank you Shelly for the work you have done with a family member in relation to discharge planning. She did not want to engage with the care team until you became involved. You put her wishes and feelings forward, which enabled her and our family to achieve the result we wanted. Having challenged the decision about discharge, she went home with a full package of care. As family members, we would like to thank you as we would not have achieved this result if you had not been at the meeting, you ensured that the least restrictive option was considered. Her husband says that no one had been listening to his wife’s wishes until you were involved.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Emmrd63
title: Made a big difference
body: I was a patient on an acute ward in Royal Glamorgan hospital, I had issues around rights, leave, medication and discharge, which Shelly supported me with by explaining my rights, speaking with ward staff and social worker, challenging decisions, and helping me prepare for ward rounds. I've been discharged now and want to thank Shelly for all of her support. Being in hospital has been a very difficult and lonely time and knowing I could call Shelly for information has made a big difference to my time in hospital.

author: Ejsc
title: Birth of son
body:
I gave birth to my third baby (boy) earlier this week. All the staff on the labour ward were exceptional. Especially Zoe the midwife who was with me from the morning until I gave birth around 7pm. I cannot praise her enough for her care through out the whole day. She was friendly, caring and put both myself and my husband at ease. Especially considering the current pandemic, Zoe made the experience feel completely normal. I could not have asked for a better midwife, and feel very lucky that I was under her care. During the birth, midwife Donna came in to assist and then took over from Zoe at the end of her shift. Donna was fantastic as well, and was a great help after labour.  
Thank you so much both Zoe and Donna.

author: hoc majorum virtus
title: A thank you to those who cared for my dad
body:
To all of those working and caring during this time,  
My father passed away on Saturday 11th April. He was one of many who have, and will continue to be beaten by the Coronavirus.  
As unthinkably painful as his death is to all his family and friends, it is possible to find some slight comfort in the knowledge of everyone who helped care for him in his last days. This is a thank you to those people. The country already thanks you all every Thursday at 8pm but on behalf of my father, we would like to thank, individually, everyone that we witnessed genuinely making a difference from the start of this awful experience until its end:  
The nurse at the 24 hour Coronavirus assessment unit, who sympathetically received and professionally triaged my father.  
The unstoppable force that was my father’s social worker, who has always made it her mission to get things done and to help with good humour and a big heart.  
Glasgow’s Golden Generation charity, who delivered us a free food package, donated by a supermarket, whilst we quarantined at home.  
The stranger and the neighbour who bought and delivered my dad’s favourite newspaper, giving him some normality in what was a very surreal time.  
My father’s GP, who was calm and kind and knew exactly what referral was needed to help us at home.  
The local pharmacists, who got to know my father and who did what they could to help us overcome the challenges.  
The women who were two of a kind and who, despite everything, pushed all constraints of time, and got my dad the adaptions and supplements he needed to stay at home safely, and maintain his sorely fought independence for just that little bit longer. They showed their compassion and patience in abundance.  
The doctor who called back from NHS24 and really listened when we noticed that my father had deteriorated.  
The over-worked but professional ambulance team, who kept their calm in the midst of mayhem and fear, and got my dad safely to the hospital.  
The mostly invisible acute admission team, that must have worked hard with my father and did everything they could to successfully stabilize him.  
The young doctors, who amongst doing critical work, took the time to call us and keep us informed.  
The newly qualified nurse in the receiving unit, who gave so much of the very little time she had to my dad. And the army of students, re-distributed staff and health care assistants who supported her.  
The young ARU doctor who, at the end of a shift, was kind, spoke honestly and answered all the questions, even the hard ones.  
The ARU consultant, who told us the truth but still managed to give hope.  
The porters who, despite new and ever-changing pressures, remained gentle and discreet.  
The male ward nurse who recognised that time was of the essence in fulfilling my father’s wishes, and who did what he could to prioritise them.  
The doctor who stayed with us and cared for my father, whilst he used all of his willpower and fortitude to make his last wishes concrete.  
The lawyers firm who moved fast and did everything in their power to make those same wishes a reality.  
The ward nurse with the multi-coloured hair clip, and the nightshift third generation nurse who shared with us, and really listened to and cared for my father.  
The healthcare assistants who carried out personal care, who gave him his last ever meal and cup of tea. They did what they could to keep his worried family calm and help them to feel grounded in what felt like a surreal hell.  
The cleaners who just took the time to smile at us, and who do an incredible job under the circumstances.  
The hospital security guards who did their job with kindness and understanding.  
The hospital cafe and shop workers who turned up, stayed open, and fed and caffeinated the person who stayed with my dad.  
And finally, the palliative care nurse who had the name and calming demeanour of a saint. He really took the time to get to know my dad and used his expertise and skill to make sure my dad felt no pain, no anxiety and no fear as he slipped away from us.  
Every one of you mostly invisible people, and many more, still unmentioned, keep working when the rest of the world must hibernate. Every single one of you has a family of your own and yet somehow, every morning you make the decision to overcome your own inevitable fear in this unstable landscape. You leave the safety of your home and go out to help others who are in greater need. Those who are vulnerable, sick, infected, and sometimes, dying.  
I hope the world really recognises what a heroic commute to work this is. Every single day.  
When Thursday night comes I hope that people clap. I hope they bang pots, play music, even sing and dance. I hope they celebrate your sacrifice as loud as they can. Not because the government tells them to, and even in spite of whatever private thoughts they may have about who is to blame for all of this loss.  
Because those who bravely care and show love to others in this world at this time especially, deserve every single decibel of gratitude.  
On behalf of my father, thank you all.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
University of Glasgow - School of Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing

author: Diagi9
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Kindness
body: We are very grateful for all of the kindness shown by staff at John Taylor Hospice. Our loved one was only with them a short time but their help and kindness to him and his family meant the world to us.

title: Great practice and advice
body: On my recent visit I was treated by one of the senior nursing staff, who was such a kind, compassionate, caring individual. She was extremely thorough in her examination of my knee, and gave me some very good advice. Best of all, she made me feel very relaxed, and had a fantastic sense of humour.  THANK YOU.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful Advice
body:
Even though the Practice is undear immense pressure at present, I have had to book GP telephone calls twice in as many weeks.  Each time I have spoken to the same GP; she has been fantastic. 
As always, THANK YOU to York House and also the the wonderful patience of the reception staff.

title: Fantastic service
body: This has been my doctors for the past three years. There is often a long wait for appointments which is the one down side to this practice. Recently, during the coronavirus pandemic, I called about a mole that was worrying me. Within 4 hours, I had spoke to a doctor working remotely, been sent in to have it looked it and photographed using specialist kit, and had the doctor call me back to give me results, reassure me, and book a follow up check in 6 weeks. Everyone I saw or spoke to were so kind and I just want to say thank you for making time for something which seems trivial, at a time when medical personnel are pushed to the limit and are very busy and at personal risk. I have seen many doctors at this practice and never seen one that dismissed my concerns, as I have experienced in other practices. Thank you Barcroft, you're worth the waiting times.

title: Amazing service
body: I would like to comment on the high levels of service given at this practice from the doctors and nurses and especially the receptionist they are always happy to help.

title: Video Consultation
body:
Just used the video consultation with this surgery today. Absolutely brilliant. You get a text and you use the link in the text and click on a few options and you're in. It saves the hassle of going to the surgery but you get to see the doctor and they can see the issue. Great work guys, well done.

Note: You do need a SmartPhone to use this service as it relies on texting, internet, camera and microphone access.

title: Great practice
body: I attended minor injuries on 27/04/20 with a knee injury & felt all the staff were excellent in what is a very difficult time, we are so lucky to have this in St.Austell.

title: Excelled help for Covid 19 Period
body: Foreland Medical practice is doing an excellent help to all patients. they continue to provide good amout of appointments in this covid 19 period fully staffed. Telephone triage by a Doctor and then Face to Face appointment too. Blood done at practice. feel lot safer than going to hospital. Foreland Practice has arranged all my medication delivered to home monthly too

title: Excellent practice
body: Arrived early and was seen within 5 mins, staff very efficient and friendly. Temperature taken on arrival and waiting room had chairs spaced out to observe the government rulings

title: Speedy service!
body:
Hi , I used the email service to leave my symptoms on sunday afternoon and a doctor rang me at 9am this morning.  I am delighted thank you😁
Thank you all for everything you are doing and please be assured it wont be forgotten when this is all over....heroes allx

title: Happy Patient
body:
Thank you to the admin staff for always being polite, helpful and efficient. Thank you to the doctors for the great service. I have been a patient for 18 months and I definitely feel cared for by everyone at the practice. I’ve never had an issue getting an appointment either in person or on the phone. Repeat prescriptions are issued within a day of the request which is always appreciated. 
Thank you!

title: Contact
body: I was phoned by a member of the practice who said she was just checking on how I was coping under quarantine.  I thought it was a very solicitous call and very much appreciated.

title: Great service.
body: Even going through the Covid 19 questions and temperature check I didn't have to wait long to see the paramedic who cleaned up my minor injury and dressed it. Very friendly and caring. I'll try not to return any time soon but if I'm stupid enough again to sustain another injury I'll be back. Out within the hour.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: I am so happy and impressed how the Lonsdale Medical Centre is handling everything during the Covid period. My son has a rush. I called them, they called back within 2 hours and after seeing the images they "treated"all over the phone and sent immediately the prescription to my pharmacy. We had another issue with our aupair and again they helped immediately. Its such a fantastic and efficient team!

title: Great treatment
body: Dealt with very professionally. Waiting time whilst attending appointments not as long as predicted. All staff very kind and reassuring. Appointments were within 2-4 weeks and second appointment after 6 week checkup was within days. I was very anxious but needn't have been. On the day I was fine. Thank you SpaMedica for a great experience.

title: No1 Practice
body: The doctors and staff are exceptional. I have been supported by the team for many years and although, like all surgeries there is sometimes a wait on the phone, I would recommend them to everyone

title: Friendliness
body: I attended the gosport eye clinic just before the lockdown and the staff were very helpful and caring because of the coronavirus threat.i needed new glasses and picked the frame.then the shop shut because of the virus and what a lovely surprise to receive the glasses by post-so thankyou for taking the trouble to post them .I thought I would have to wait a long time.

title: Trusted care and treated like a person as well as…
body: It's at worrying times like at present that you really appreciate the dedication of the staff at your GP practice. Then again, my husband and I have always found the invaluable care, treatment, advice and friendly reassurance provided by the clinicians at Parkside to be exceptional and, after all, this is surely the most important criteria by which any practice should be judged.

title: Excellent care and attention
body: The doctors are extremely professional and caring, I have had only good experiences from Tudor Lodge. They have gone out of their way to be helpful, delivering a prompt and personalised service. Highly recommended.

title: Exceptional Care
body:
Following a very serious accident I would like to express my very sincere thanks to your wonderful & very experienced staff who couldnt have been more helpful & reassuring .
The professionalism shown & the attention to detail makes me feel very humble & to experience such devotion to duty was outstanding 
All at the Q.E.should be very proud of the service they give not just to me but all other patients & the memory of such service in a period of anxiety will remain with me forever.
Please convey my heartfelt thanks to all who saw me through this trauma whose names escape me & who were such a mix of nationalities all working harmoniously with a great sense of humour at a very sombre moment.
I am so grateful & with best wishes to you all at this particular time 
Roger Messenger

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: fantastic service
body: I attended Anticoagultant department yesterday Monday 27 Th. to take a test due to change in medication.Fantastic professional efficient service, feel very confident in advice given by staff. Even under the stresses of coronavirus the staff were welcoming and helpful. Thanks for everything. Maybe this will be a wake up call for the Government and they will offer the support the NHS needs and deserves. Thanks and stay safe. Doug

title: I cannot recommend this GP surgery enough!!!
body:
The Doctor and the receptionists have been amazing dealing with my father's situation. I would like to thank them personally for their service, on how effective and amazing their GP surgery is. If my father is alive today is thanks to the receptionist I had on the phone 3 weeks ago who had contacted his GP, and his GP called the ambulance and put my father as an emergency patient. 
Without their immediate action, my father would not have make it today and I am extremely grateful for all their help and for taking his health very seriously.  
Also, the receptionists that I have been dealing with for my father follow ups, requests and referrals after his hospitalisation either over the phone or by email have been extremely professional and caring. Amazing service ! 

From the bottom of my heart, thank you to each and every one of you ! I am forever grateful and I am very happy that my father is your one of their patient as I know he is getting the best care at this GP surgery.  I am still amazed by their professionalism and I would 1000% recommend this GP surgery. Thank you ever so much !

title: Extremly poor services
body:
Reception staff are rude and unhelpful.
Very difficult to get an appointment with a doctor. Lack of continuity of care, seeing different GP (even though i request to see the same person) and each GP comes up with a different plan of care. Very frustrating as i have some long standing issues and i'm trying to get a diagnosis. Also being referred to a pharmacist instead of a doctor is very disappointing. No disrespect to clinical pharmacists, i work alongside them but i feel it makes the process longer as there are certain things they can not do and have to refer you back to the GP for further consultation/testing.

title: Great response
body: Two excellent paramedics came out to me early hours of Monday morning, they were friendly, efficient, and very caring. Many thanks.

title: Brilliant Nursing Team
body: The nursing team and lead practitioner in the surgery are amazing. They triage and treat as well as the doctors and I honestly can not recommend them highly enough.

title: All that I could have hoped for.
body:
The Vauxhall Surgery Practice was recommended to me when I was not happy with my previous doctor’s surgery and I can see why. 
I have been so impressed by my treatment since joining the surgery and everyone there. 
The receptionists are polite and professional.
Upon joining the practice I was sent for blood tests - something that I've never had before. 
The results were discussed with the practice nurse afterwards.
The doctors I have spoken to have been extremely professional, diligent, caring, respectful and have not been in the least bit condescending. 
I have found my new surgery to be all that I could have hoped for.

author: Gen-Eric
title: Wonderful Advocate
body:
In March 2020, I was admitted to the Burbage Ward at the Michael Carlisle Centre in Sheffield.  
This was really a difficult and distressing time for me and I needed some help and advice. to understand my situation. My wife contacted Sheffield Advocacy Hub to arrange an advocate for me.  
I was contacted by a wonderful advocate called Muriel. Who immediately gave me hope and confidence that my situation would be manageable and not indefinite. This immediately relieved some of the stress and uncertainty of my situation, and I felt able to cope more readily with the circumstances that I was in.  
Muriel gave clear, concise advice, informed me of my rights and helped me gain release from the hospital environment back into my home.  
The hospital experience was traumatising and I don't know how I would have coped without Muriel's help and support. I would highly recommend this service to anyone in this situation.

title: Rude nurse
body: Extremely rude nurse advising me she “wasn’t going to break open the morphine cupboard” - I never even asked for pain killers nor have I ever taken them, I had just advised that the paracetamol and ibuprofen I had been taking for a week had not been relieving the pain I was in. She told me I had an attitude - not surprising really when I’ve gone for help and she has implied I was only there for drugs. Disgusting behaviour for someone, supposedly in the healthcare profession, to have. Told to keep taking the paracetamol and ibuprofen, even though it’s not giving me any relief. No sleep due to pain and too afraid to go and see another medical professional due to the way I have been spoken to and accusations made by this one person. Have never had a bad experience before however it’s people like this who let our healthcare service down and make people too afraid to seek help.

readBy.name: Lincolnshire Community Health Services NHS Trust

author: Worried from Worplesdon
title: Lack of staff PPE and social distancing
body:
I decided to go to Milford Hospital for a chest X-ray as recommended by my doctor following a persistent cough. I thought it might be safer to go to Milford compared to Royal Surrey Hospital. I may have been wrong in that assessment because the admin reception had no facial mask or any other body protection equipment.They sat at maximum 2 metres from me whilst in waiting room.  
The radiologist just had a conventional face mask which again concerned me.  
The entrance to the building needed hand pushing I think on metal surfaces... it was not good and I should have turned around and left but did not have the courage to do so.  
There was no-one in the waiting room when I arrived but on leaving I could not ensure the 2 metre rule from a patient who sat by the exit door with no mask or any other protection. He was around 40 years old and could have been a carrier of the virus.  
I am now worried that I may have caught the virus through no fault of my own based on lack of basic hospital disciplines. As yet I do not show any symptoms but that is not the point.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: N-ckym
title: No name or instructions on tablets collected for my dad
body: My 70 yr old dad has been unwell and deteriorating for several weeks, today we had to phone 111 for some advice and guidance. AFter speaking with a fantastic nurse and doctor on the phone. He advised to start some new medication until he could see his gp on Monday. I was told exactly where to pick up the prescription etc and made my way there. On getting there I spoke with someone who handed me a box of tablets and a prescription to hand into a pharmacy. The box of medication had no patient name on it, no instructions, no date or department it came from and no instructions of how many tablets to take. I attempted to phone the department twice to complain and voice my concerns about this and was told no one was available to answer. I eventually (when I handed in his prescription )got to speak with a general pharmacist for advice who was also unhappy at the lack of information we were given. I am a healthcare professional myself, I am fully aware that this is unacceptable and dangerous. These tablets could of been given to anyone and even more negligent that there was nothing to tell my dad how many to take. Very poor indeed.

author: ajgettingbetter
title: Needed help and I found it
body:
I am going through menopause and this is not easy. I feel old, am suffering with anxiety, self-doubt, foggy brain, loosing energy, resilience and emotional instability made me realise I needed to speak with someone about everything that I was going through. This is not me nor did I want to be depressed, confused and anxious all the time.  
I could not have asked for a better experience. I had to wait a long time for personal counselling but felt that was what I needed. After about 5 months I was lucky to have been placed in the hands of my counselor Amarpreet.  
Her empathy, patience and her professional manner with what I was going through allowed me to gain more of myself back. I truly felt that every time I met with her; I knew I walked out of that room a better person. Each time feeling like I was gaining a bit more of myself back and there are not enough words to say how grateful I am and will forever be thankful to the service provided and most important to her innate support and ability to truly understand what I was feeling/going through and most important the tools I need in my life to make things better for me and have gained confidence to do this.  
There is no doubt I have gained strength to help myself make the changes I need to make in my life to better myself and I am a stronger person for that. Of course, I know that I have more work to do on myself and would have wanted more time with her.  
Thank you, Amarpreet, and thank you Bromley Healthcare for the help and support you provided.

author: leek690
title: I need to speak to my mum's stroke specialist
body: my mum is currently in Wishaw General and I need to speak to her Stroke specialist. I have called to speak to their receptionist on numerous occasions to arrange a telephone meeting but it continously rings out. How am I meant to arrange this if I can't get in contact in the 1st instance.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Muggie
title: Cancer treatment
body: Excellent care from start to finish, hysterectomy and radiotherapy, everyone was extremely professional and kind, which is exactly what you need at such a scary time

title: Poor care
body: Hospital cancelled all appointments but did not let any of the patients know. The website is not up to date and does not give accurate information to patients. There is no understanding that patients without coronavirus may also need treatment. It is a bad time for anyone to fall ill.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Digglepants
title: Above and beyond the call of duty
body:
With the covid 19 virus at the time coming to a and e I was scared as I didn’t have it. I went as thought I had a blood clot. I was there for a total of about 3 hours while there they seemed to be very busy I was met by a nurse at the main door asked if I had any symptoms but I didn’t and was let into reception. I got seen within a few mins and I must say a big well done to all the nurses that looked after me and others while I was there. They did there job above and Beyond there call of duty. Thanku. stars out of five well all I can say is five stars all round. They sorted me out got me seen and back home.  
Thanku again

author: PAFB64
title: Treatment from a side effect of anticoagulant
body:
After a pulmonary embolism in December 2919 I was placed on an anticoagulant. I suddenly began to suffer from prolonged heavy bleeding I attended the Women’s day clinic and was promptly admitted. They needed to stop the bleeding and investigated the root cause. All of which was complicated by the anticoagulant; the proven drugs and procedures could result in blood clots.  
I was admitted to ward 208 Gynaecology. From my very first encounter with the team from the women’s clinic to the ward and through all the work they did to help me the information was clear precise and honest. I could ask any question and nothing was too much. They introduced themselves so I knew all their names and they treated me with dignity and respect - I was an emotional patient who was very wary about the procedures they had to perform. They make it clear that the treatment was lead by my tolerances and dealt with in a kind profession and just downright humane manner. It made for me a very distressing situation bearable and I cannot thank them all enough. The ward was clean the food was good and ALL staff were fabulous. PPE was hampering the way the Team wanted to deliver their care but they did so so well.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
